title: Pearson extends its losses a day after profit warning
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Oct 22, 2015, 19:46 BST - UK Markets closed Pearson extends its losses a day after profit warning By Tara Cunningham | Telegraph – 34 minutes ago 13.46 -0.54 
Shares (Berlin: DI6.BE - news ) in publisher Pearson (Xetra: 858266 - news ) slumped by almost 21pc in just two trading sessions. 
Publisher Pearson failed to make the best-seller list for a second-consecutive trading session. 
A day after the FTSE 100 company slashed its full-year forecasts, the stock was hit after a slew of brokers downgraded its rating. 
In a note entitled “flying blind”, Barclays (LSE: BARC.L - news ) said it was concerned about the lack of visibility the FTSE 100 company had in July when it published its half-year report. 
Nick Dempsey, of Barclays, said: “At that stage the outlook for North America was benign, with Higher Education courseware seen as broadly level for the year.” Pearson 3-day graph (Source: Bloomberg) 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) was not solely brokers responsible for its dismal performance, the University of Florida also added to its woes after it announced plans to terminate an 11-year contract with Pearson, which relates to the administration of online degree programs. * Shares in Pearson slump as publisher warns on profits Although Pearson only signed the contract last year, the university said it had failed to meet certain performance goals. The news comes after its US rival Harcourt enjoyed contract wins in many states in which Pearson enjoys a dominant position, such as Texas and California. 
Neil Campling, of Aviate Global, said: “Piece by piece Pearson’s legacy footprint is being taken apart and compounded by difficulties in adopting digital solutions.” 
Shares in the education publisher, which sold the FT Group and its 50pc stake in The Economist Group earlier this year, has fallen 20.8pc to 950p in just two days (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) .
